page.title: 03 LODDINGTON HOUSING
page.content: The central part of the village, around the church is of old houses, farms and cottages built in local limestone. (Slide B) Cottages dating from the late 1800's surround this central area and are mainly brick. The outskirts of the village have three different types of housing. There is an unlovely brick and concrete council estate. The most modern houses, both on a small estate and on individual plots are thoughtfully designed and constructed. A small group of retirement bungalows stands beside the church. Outside the village is a house called 'Three Chimneys' (Slide D). This is a local landmark and is shown on O.S. maps.
